data.title: Kempston Rural Primary School
data.meta_description: School Ratings for Kempston Rural Primary School, Martell Drive, Kempston, Bedfordshire, MK42 7FJ. This school was rated Good by Ofsted in December 2023. For it's latest set of KS2 results 74 percent of students met the expected standard in Reading, Writing and Maths and 6 percent of students met the higher standard.
data.text:
Type Primary Age Range 5-11 Religion Does not apply Address Martell Drive

Kempston

Bedfordshire

MK42 7FJ Phone 01234854286 Reference Number 109463

Description

beta

Kempston Rural Primary School is located on Martell Drive in Kempston, Bedfordshire, with the postal code MK42 7FJ. The school strives to create a nurturing and inclusive environment where students are encouraged to flourish and exhibiting happiness, health, and safety as key principles. Its curriculum focuses on developing the skills, abilities, and talents of all pupils, and it upholds British values, such as democracy, rule of law, individual liberty, mutual respect for those of different faiths and cultural backgrounds.

The school accommodates 440 pupils, starting from age 5 to 11, and is categorized as a community school. It is part of the Bedford local authority, with Mrs. A Stanbridge serving as the headteacher/principal. Kempston Rural offers a nursery class for young learners, although it does not have a sixth form. Its percentage of children eligible for free school meals stands at 12.9%. School Milestone information regarding its opening date is not available.
